verbs.description: aggrandize (third-person singular simple present aggrandizes, present participle aggrandizing, simple past and past participle aggrandized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make great; to enlarge; to increase.
(transitive) To make great or greater in power, rank, honor, or wealth (applied to persons, countries, etc.).
examples: [因  the aggrandizing of your estate by well managed fortune  [因  may well set out your praises to the world  [因

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make appear great or greater; to exalt.
examples: [因  they contrive to make all approaches to them difficult and vexatious, and imagine that they aggrandize themselves by wasting the time of others in useless attendance, by mortifying them with slights, and teazing them with affronts.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, rare) To increase or become great.
examples: The generals, like Hitler, wanted Germany to aggrandize at the expense of neighboring countries, and to do so if necessary by force or threat of force.
